rounds.observation:
[GAME] Welcome to the Tic Tac Toe Arena! You are competing as Player 0.
Victory is achieved by claiming three consecutive squares in any direction: horizontal, vertical, or diagonal.
To make your move, choose a numbered position (0-8) on the grid and submit it in brackets.
Example: '[7]' will claim the bottom-right corner of the board.

Your battle symbol is 'O', while your opponent fights with 'X'.

---+---+---
 6 | 7 | 8

I need to block the diagonal threat where Player 0 (O) has cell 8 and cell 4. If I don't block, they could complete the diagonal [2]-[4]-[6] with [2] being the winning move.

[2]

rounds.response:
Now I must prevent the vertical three-in-a-column down the right side ([2]-[5]-[8]).  
My opponent already has O in [8] and [2] is my X, so their immediate threat is [5]; if I don’t take [5], they will take it next and win with the column.

[5]

rounds.response:
My mistake — I meant to block the vertical threat on the right side, which requires preventing a three-in-a-column at [2]-[5]-[8]. Since [2] and [8] are already filled, the square I need to block is actually [5].  
Therefore I'll now claim it.

[5]
